title: Allocator Assignments
content:

  • ››Allocator Assignments

Allocator Assignments

 

  • Allocator Assignments
    • Creating Allocator Assignment
    • Editing Allocator Assignment
    • Deleting an Allocator Assignment

Allocator Assignments specify the user who is responsible for allocating a given item from a particular source location during strategy selection.  Multiple users may have created strategies for the same item and source location.  A single strategy needs to be identified when allocating a supply.

If there is an allocation strategy defined for the allocator and style/Item, at the source location, then that strategy is picked up during allocation. Otherwise, the system looks for a strategy without any allocator assignment.

This page is accessible by administrators only. Each allocator assignment can be configured at the Source Location Id and Item Hierarchy Levels. 

 

 

Filters: 

  • Allocator
  • Source Location Id
  • Approver
  • Hierarchy Level 1
  • Hierarchy Level 2
  • Hierarchy Level 3
  • Hierarchy Level 4
  • Hierarchy Level 5
  • Hierarchy Level 6
Note: Only six hierarchy filters will be displayed in the filter panel. Users can add the rest of the hierarchy levels from the Available Filters section in the Customize Filters window.  

Creating Allocator Assignment

 

To create an allocator assignment:

  1. Select Menu > Configurations  > User > Allocator Assignments
  2. Click Create to view the Create New Allocator Assignment wizard. 
  3. From the Create Allocator Assignment section, Select Source Location Id from the drop-down list. If the Source Location Id is not selected, the Allocator is available for all the locations created under the Item Category.
  4. Select Allocator from the drop-down list.
  5. Select Hierarchy Level 1 (This field is mandatory),  Hierarchy Level 2,  Hierarchy Level 3,  and all the other applicable Hierarchy Levels from the respective drop-down lists. The number of hierarchy fields displayed here will depend on how many hierarchy levels are configured. Hierarchy Level 1 must be defined before Hierarchy Level 2 and so on.  The first hierarchy level value drop-down contains distinct entries from the corresponding field in the Item entity. The next hierarchy level value drop-down contains distinct entities from the corresponding field in Item entity with matching hierarchy values in the previous level. All higher hierarchy levels must be defined. 
  1. Select Approver from the drop-down list.
  2. Choose Yes or No for Submitted Allocation Requires Approval.
  3. Click Save and Continue.
  4. On the Allocator Team Assignment page,  Click Create. The Allocator Team Assignment page is displayed. This configuration assigns teams to various destination location categories. This step is not mandatory. The admin user and manager are able to configure the hierarchy and level of location hierarchy to specify teams.
  5. Select the Location Hierarchy Level 1(This value will be empty if you are not configured in a hierarchy or hierarchy level), Location Hierarchy Level 2, and Location Hierarchy Level 3 from the drop-down list.
  6. Select the Team Id from the drop-down list.  The admin users and managers will set teams for respective location categories. There can be just one team for a location category for an allocator assignment.
  7. Click Save and Finish. The allocator assignment is created.

Editing Allocator Assignment

 

To edit an allocator assignment:

  1. Select Menu > Configurations  > User > Allocator Assignments
Note: You can edit an allocator assignment record either through the swipe-out board, or the Edit button. 

Swipe Out Board

  1. Select swipe-out board on the required record and select Edit.
  2. From the Edit Create Allocator Assignment wizard, modify the required fields.
  3. From the Edit Allocator Team Assignment wizard,  you cannot modify the required fields.
  4. Click Finish and Save to save the modified allocator assignment details.

Edit View

  1. Select the required record. The action buttons are displayed in the footer section.
  2. Click the Edit button to view the Edit Create Allocator Assignment wizard. Modify the required sections.
  3. Click the Edit button to view the Edit Allocator Team Assignment wizard. The user cannot modify the required fields.
  4. Click Finish and Save to save the modified allocator assignment details.

Deleting an Allocator Assignment

To delete an allocator assignment:

Select Menu > Configurations  > User > Allocator Assignments

Note: You can edit an allocator assignment record either through the swipe-out board, or Delete button. 

Swipe Out Board

  1. Select swipe-out board on the required record and click Delete.
  2. A warning message pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Allocator Assignments is irreversible'.
  3. Click Yes to delete the allocator assignments record.

Delete

  1. Select the required record card. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. A warning message pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Allocator Assignments is irreversible'.
  3. Click Yes to delete the allocator assignments record.

 

Field Description

Following are the field descriptions attributes:

 

Field

Description

Create Allocator Assignment
Allocator Select the required user from the drop-down list.
 Hierarchy Level 1 to Hierarchy Level 10 The Item hierarchy levels.
Source Location Id Select the required source location id from the drop-down list.
Allocator Team Assignment
Location Hierarchy Level 1 to Location Hierarchy Level 3

The location hierarchy levels. These fields are mandatory.

Note: The user can create a location hierarchy of up to 5 levels.
Team Id Select the team id from the drop-down list. The admin users and managers will set teams for respective location categories. This is the pre-defined value. The user has to create Team Id from the Manage Teams entity.
Action Buttons
Edit  Edit the allocator assignment records. This button is available in multiple sections of the screen. Read Edit Allocator Assignment for more information.
Delete Click this button to delete the allocator assignment record.
Select All Rows Click this button to select all allocator assignment records.
Deselect Click this button to clear the selected records.

 

Use the below configurations to enable the Location Hierarchy in adding the Create Allocator Team Assignment step of Alocator Assignments creation. 

 

 

POST:                                                                                                                                                   {{url}}/ai-allocation/api/ai-allocation/allocationConfig/save                                                                                              {                                                                                                                                                          "ConfigValue": "Primary",                                                                                                                                "ConfigId": "AllocatorAssignmentLocationHierarchyId",                                                                                                      }                                                                                                                                                  This API is used to define location hierarchy ids for allocator assignment configuration. 

 

POST:                                                                                                                                                   {{url}}/ai-allocation/api/ai-allocation/allocationConfig/save                                                                                              {                                                                                                                                                          "ConfigValue": "Primary",                                                                                                                                "ConfigId": "AllocatorAssignmentLocationHierarchyLevel",                                                                                                      }                                                                                                                                                This API is used to define location hierarchy levels for allocator assignment configuration.
